benchmark_details.name: BELLS (Benchmark for the Evaluation of LLM Supervision Systems)
benchmark_details.overview: The BELLS benchmark systematically evaluates supervision systems for LLMs across two key axes—harm severity and adversarial sophistication—covering three jailbreak families and eleven harm categories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive public benchmark that verifies the performance of supervision systems under realistic and diverse attacks.

data.source: Constructed from existing harm taxonomies and non-adversarial prompt collections, with adversarial data augmented using various techniques.
data.size: 5,990 prompts (990 non-adversarial prompts and 5,000+ adversarial prompts)
data.annotation: Initial categorization by GPT-4 followed by independent human review.

methodology.calculation: The BELLS Score combines detection rates on adversarial and non-adversarial harmful prompts, penalized by false positive rates.
methodology.interpretation: Higher BELLS Scores indicate better overall performance in detecting harmful content while minimizing false positives.
methodology.validation: Benchmark evaluated against specialized supervision systems and general-purpose LLMs.
